message.content:
cs.SE, cs.CE, cs.PL, cs.MS, cs.DL. 

The paper discusses best practices for making research software more robust, which is relevant to several sub-categories of computer science. cs.SE (Software Engineering) is the most likely category as it specifically deals with software development and maintenance. cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science) and cs.PL (Programming Languages) are also likely as they involve developing software for scientific applications. cs.MS (Mathematical Software) is relevant as the paper discusses mathematical software and algorithms. Finally, cs.DL (Digital Libraries) is a possibility as the paper discusses making software more accessible and usable for collaborators and users.
